snippet: The city of Charlotte has agreed to pay $2.25 million to the family of Jonathan Ferrell, an unarmed black man shot and killed by a white police officer two years ago.
abstract: City of Charlotte, NC, will pay $2.25 million to family of Jonathan Ferrell, unarmed black man who was shot and killed by police officers in 2013; city admits no fault or liability in settlement.
lead_paragraph: The city of Charlotte has agreed to pay $2.25 million to the family of Jonathan Ferrell, an unarmed black man shot and killed by a white police officer two years ago.

headline.main: North Carolina: Deal Reached Over Killing by Officer
headline.print_headline: North Carolina: Deal Reached Over Killing by Officer
